title: Population in China 2008 - 2018 , by gender
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Male, and Female. The y axis indicates the Population in million inhabitants and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Female is gradually increasing, Male is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Male, and lastly, 2. Female.
Throughout the period, Male generally had the highest Population in million inhabitants relative to others with an average of 697.94, and it reached its maximum at 2018 with a value of 713.51.
Female mostly had the least Population in million inhabitants with a mean value of 663.52, which peaked at 2018 with a value of 681.87.

max_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Male, and Female. The y axis indicates the Population in million inhabitants and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Female is gradually increasing, Male is roughly constant,  throughout the Year
The lines ordered according to average values of Population in million inhabitants in descending order is: 1. Male, and lastly, 2. Female.
Overall across the Year, Male mostly maintained the highest Population in million inhabitants when compared to others with a mean value of 697.94, and it peaked at 2018.
Female mostly had the least Population in million inhabitants with a mean value of 663.52, which peaked at 2018 with a value of 681.87.
Female reported the lowest Population in million inhabitants about 644.45 in Year 2008
The greatest difference of Population in million inhabitants between Male and Female occurs at Year 2008 and the smallest difference occurs at 2018.
